steps.notes: Mine mare regolith from surface
Screen and separate size fractions
Crush and grind coarse regolith to powder
Extract oxygen and produce metal byproduct via MRE

recipe_def.assumptions: Co-product metal alloy from MRE; refining not modeled.

steps.notes: Cast outer shell sections from steel
Weld shell sections together
Apply sintered refractory lining
Final assembly with insulation layers

recipe_def.assumptions: 500 kg furnace shell with refractory lining for high-temp operation.
recipe_def.notes: Four-step recipe for refractory-lined furnace shell.

steps.notes: Cast heating element blanks from high-temp alloy
Machine element geometry and connection points
Assemble element set with insulators and terminals

recipe_def.assumptions: 80 kg high-temp heating elements for furnaces/reactors.
recipe_def.notes: Three-step recipe for high-temperature heating element set.
Local production path for regolith_powder from regolith_coarse_fraction via regolith_crushing_grinding_v0.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for regolith_powder (v0)

recipe_def.notes: Regolith-based insulation production from regolith_powder; placeholder process.

steps.notes: Form regolith-based insulation into panels/blankets and kit into a high-temp pack.

recipe_def.assumptions: Regolith-based insulation can be formed into high-temperature panels with adequate thermal performance.
recipe_def.notes: Local alternative to ceramic fiber-based insulation pack using regolith-derived insulation.
recipe_def.name: High-temp insulation pack from regolith-based insulation

steps.notes: Cast metal billets/ingots
Roll to sheet/plate form
Trim and finish edges

recipe_def.assumptions: ISRU route using regolith metal; 5% casting loss, 2% rolling loss, 3% machining loss
recipe_def.notes: ISRU variant using regolith_metal_crude from regolith. Enables local production of sheet metal and structural steel.

steps.notes: Fabricate chamber shell sections, end caps, and flanges from steel plate
Weld chamber shell with hermetic seals for atmosphere control, install access ports and penetrations
Machine flange faces and port threads for gas-tight sealing
Pressure test chamber for leak-tightness and atmosphere containment capability

recipe_def.assumptions: Heavy-duty steel construction with hermetic welding for controlled atmosphere applications. Leak-tested to ensure gas-tight operation for inert atmosphere or vacuum processing.
recipe_def.notes: Sealed chamber shell for controlled atmosphere processing equipment. Hermetic construction maintains inert gas or vacuum environment. Total fabrication time ~14 hours.

steps.notes: Cast tubing sections and fittings
Machine fitting interfaces
Braze tube joints and fittings
Final assembly with pump and valves

recipe_def.assumptions: 60 kg cooling loop with metal tubing and brazed joints.
recipe_def.notes: Four-step recipe for thermal control cooling loop.

steps.notes: Cast fastener blanks and washer stock in batch molds
Machine threads and washer profiles from cast blanks
Heat treat fasteners for strength and spring properties
Inspect heat-treated fasteners for hardness and dimensional checks
Sort fasteners by size (M6, M8, M10, M12), count, and kit

recipe_def.assumptions:
Simplified fastener manufacturing from metal alloy bulk to finished kit:
- Cast blanks for bolts, nuts, and washers
- Machine threads and profiles
- Heat treat for strength and spring properties
- Final inspection and kitting

Input materials: 2.0 kg steel_stock
Output: 1.0 kg complete fastener kit per BOM specification
Scrap rate: ~50% from casting/machining losses (conservative placeholder)
recipe_def.notes:
Simplified local recipe for fastener_kit_medium production.

Kit composition per bom_fastener_kit_medium_v0:
- 720g hex bolts M6-M12 in various lengths (76 pieces total)
- 180g hex nuts M6-M12 (135 pieces total)
- 75g flat washers M6-M12 (135 pieces total)
- 30g lock washers M6-M12 (60 pieces total)
Total: ~366 fasteners, 1.0 kg net weight

Manufacturing process details:
1. Casting: Form blanks for bolts, nuts, and washers
2. Threading: Cut external threads on bolts, tap nuts
3. Heat treatment: Quench and temper bolts to grade 8.8 equivalent, harden lock washers
4. Inspection: Verify hardness and dimensional checks
5. Kitting: Sort by size, verify counts, package in compartmented container
References detailed specification in design/memos/fastener_kit_specification.md
Most commonly used fastener kit in the KB (107 BOMs reference this item)

steps.notes: Fabricate outer chamber shell and mounting frame, install multi-layer refractory lining for 1600-3000C capability, install heating elements/temperature sensors/control systems, install gas handling system and cooling loops, assemble all components/install insulation/seal chamber, test heating performance/atmosphere control/temperature uniformity

recipe_def.assumptions: High-temperature furnace capable of 1600-3000C for carbothermal reduction and sintering. Can use resistance heating or solar concentration.
recipe_def.notes: High-temperature furnace for advanced materials processing. Critical for tungsten sintering, calcium oxide extraction, and other high-temperature chemical processes.
